content: The African Caribbean society is a welcoming community for people of any and every background. If you are African, Caribbean, or interested in celebrating African and Caribbean culture, then ACS is for you! Throughout the year, the society offers a wide variety of social and careers-focused events, providing members access to the best job opportunities and a familiar community within Imperial. Networking events guide students to success at university and offer opportunities from top organizations. Members can interact with other African Caribbean societies across London and the UK, including social events such as Impulse clubbing and corporate collaborations. The society's cultural showcase event, AFROGALA, is the biggest event of the year, where members get to be involved in the creation of an amazing show for a good cause.

content: The Algorithmic Trading Society aims to bridge the gap between university studies and professional knowledge in the field of algorithmic trading. They host weekly sessions on their platform Pedlar, covering topics from basic trading terminologies to reinforcement learning. The events are tailored for members of all levels, from learning basic concepts to advanced trading simulations, and provide exclusive exposure to their sponsors through workshops and competitions. This year, they will also introduce a machine learning course led by a PhD student to help members build a stronger technical foundation. The society welcomes both novice and veteran traders to be part of their community.

content: Welcome to the friendliest, most exciting, up and coming clubs at ICSM! We welcome people of all subjects (not just medics) and have a wide mix of ages and abilities. It's the best of both worlds! Whether you want to play competitively, in one of our four highly competitive teams or just want some casual exercise with your friends – there's something for everyone! For team members, we host training twice a week and weekly games run by our fabulous team captains! For our social players, our friendly sessions boast an incredible atmosphere, and you won't believe how much you'll improve throughout the year. We are always looking for new players each year, so make sure you come to our give-it-a-go sessions at the start of term and show up at our trials! Badminton aside, the club also hosts many social events from lively sports nights, bowling, our international tour (where could we be this year?), NAMs tournament and dinners throughout the year. For loads of fun on and off court come join us today! Come along to our weekly social sessions, our stall at fresher's fair or check out our Instagram: @icsmbadminton or contact our President (Isabelle) at ias119@ic.ac.uk!

content: The Imperial College Basketball team consists of six teams, including three competitive men's teams, two competitive women's teams, and one recreational team. The club caters to players of all abilities, from beginners to experienced or professional players. The Basketball society has been very successful in recent years, with the Women's 1st team consistently topping their league and the Men's 3rd team being first in the BUCS 4 league in 2024. The club was also named Imperial's Sports Club of the Year in 2019 and has been nominated again in 2024. Throughout the year, the team organizes various basketball events, such as end-of-term charity tournaments, a team Thanksgiving meal, a Christmas dinner, and an annual international tour, providing players with opportunities to connect and have fun beyond just playing the sport.

content: Imperial College Biochemistry Society (BiochemSoc) is a student-led organization that provides social, academic, and career events for STEM students. It is one of the largest and most active departmental societies at Imperial, with around 700 members enjoying various events and resources such as the 'Exploring Biochemistry' webinar series, career insight talks, and Q&As. The society also hosts social activities like welcome events, cook-alongs, ice skating, and an exclusive black-tie Spring Ball. BiochemSoc works with sponsors and partners to offer members insights into potential career paths through networking workshops, seminars, and career fairs. During the pandemic, the society adapted by hosting online events, including submission-based sports competitions, food and fashion events. Going forward, they plan to host more in-person events, including Union bar outings, picnics, and a trip to Winter Wonderland. The society's main aims are to connect people across Life Sciences, enrich members' university experience, increase employability, and widen students' perspectives beyond their degree learning.

content: Interested in scientific writing? Want to meet established science journalists, and to see your own articles published online and on print? As a student-led initiative, we provide a platform for students of all stages and backgrounds to freely explore the most emergent themes of the life sciences. Our articles and magazine issues are also free to access – an aspect that we hope diminishes the barrier to science. Established in August 2020, we have since grown our base to over 120 yearly writers and published over 500 articles. If you join our enthusiastic group of writers, you will benefit from editorial feedback, improving your writing and research skills. Watch out for the various opportunities to present your work and attend guest speaker events throughout the year! We also intend to collaborate with other Imperial societies and top UK universities in affordable networking events.

content: Join us and you will share a common hobby with Warren Buffet and Bill Gates! Bridge is a card game played in pairs (your friends!), relying on skill, educated guesses and most importantly, fun! The rules are simple but gameplay encapsulates depth, which is perfect for anyone with an eye for calculation and competition. The Imperial College Bridge Club caters to all bridge players! Whether you are a seasoned player or an evergreen player, you will enjoy your time with us through the lessons and playing! Additionally, we organize casual in-house competitions among our members termly where you and your partner can show off your skills while engaging with your fellow peers. We do participate in competitions, competing against other universities as well! We usually meet Tuesdays from 6pm to 8pm in Blackett 741 followed by a social drink or two at the Union Bar. Refreshments are also provided during sessions. Come join to learn about this card game that even AI have yet to crack!

content: Cameroon Catalyst is an international development charity focused on promoting sustainable development in the Eastern region of Cameroon, founded in 2009. Its mission is to be a catalyst for sustainable change in rural Cameroon by designing infrastructure projects that empower local communities and provide them with the tools to develop and grow long beyond the projects. Student involvement is at the heart of the charity and crucial to its success, with student teams leading the design, construction, and fundraising of the projects, providing hands-on experience in engineering development and the not-for-profit sector. More information is available on the organization's Facebook page.

content: The most active student-led white-water kayaking club in London! Open to complete beginners and pros alike we travel the UK and further afield to find the best white-water with great company. Whether you're a complete beginner or a gnarly V+ river runner, joining the Canoe Club is a great way to add to your Imperial experience! We run regular white-water weekend trips around the most picturesque parts of England and Wales, including Snowdonia, the Lake District, and Devon. These trips are a great way to get out of London and have loads of fun. We also head further afield a few times a year to the likes of Scotland, the Alps, and Norway catering to differing skill levels so everyone has a chance to experience foreign white-water (Summer Tour is an ICCC classic). Some of our more skilled members have ventured on expeditions as far as Georgia, India, and Vietnam with their kayaks! The best way to see what ICCC has to offer is at our weekly pool sessions on Tuesday evenings at Ethos. You can get to grips with the basics or improve your freestyle tricks, then finish off with a few games of canoe polo. We then head to the Union for a pint or two after. We also hold regular socials/sports nights to get to know the other paddlers off the river! Whether drinking or non-drinking socials are your thing there's something for everyone.

Caters to all skill levels

content: We are the Catholic Society, welcome to our page! We are a very dynamic society, and we host regular events. Everyone is welcome wherever you are in your faith journey! We work hard, we pray and we play! We come together every Wednesday @1pm for Mass in the Chaplaincy, 15 Prince's Gardens, followed by a delicious free lunch, on us 😛. We are wealthy in friendship, faith and funds! We are ice-skating, bowling and baking enthusiasts. We hold monthly pub socials and events for Christmas and New Year, and an exciting annual Pilgrimage! We work closely with the central Catholic Chaplaincy for London's Universities - Newman House! And, we send each other birthday cards. [Beware if you don't tell us your birthday, do expect daily spam messages from us]. Our Chaplain is Fr Kensy. We also have a lively and lovely committee. Reach out to any of us, if you have any questions, we don't bite 👾. Follow us on Instagram for our latest updates, and join our mailing list for the latest updates! And join our WhatsApp group 📲.

content: The College's flagship choir, the Chamber Choir is an auditioned ensemble of about 25 singers conducted by Patrick Allies. They rehearse on Tuesday evenings and frequently visit the Postgraduate Bar afterwards. The Chamber Choir is one of London's finest university choirs, performing regularly in the capital, across the UK, and internationally in notable venues like Buckingham Palace, Windsor Castle, and cathedrals in Italy and Spain. They present up to two concerts per term, sing fortnightly Wednesday evensongs, and undertake various external projects such as weddings, recordings, and recitals. The choir goes on a 5-day Easter tour, a week-long summer tour, and several weekend trips throughout the year, which are highlights of the musical and social calendar.

content: The Christian Union (CU) is a group of people who want to know Jesus Christ better and tell everyone about him. They welcome all people from all backgrounds, whatever they think of Jesus. As a society, they want to give everyone at Imperial the opportunity to investigate the claims of Jesus, because they believe Jesus is relevant for all people throughout all time, including today at Imperial College. Their weekly events include a Bible study on Monday evening going through the life of Jesus, a gathering on Thursday evening equipping CU members to tell others about Jesus, and a lunchtime talk on Friday afternoon answering big questions about life and how they relate to Jesus. They also run plenty of extra events throughout the year. CU is not a substitute for a local church: they unite as students who attend different churches to make Christ known on their campus. They unite around their doctrinal basis, which can be found at http://www.uccf.org.uk/about/doctrinal-basis. You can always contact them if there's anything you want to ask!

content: Imperial Medics Cricket Club has a strong tradition of attracting the best sportsmen and women that Imperial has to offer. The club has 3 teams that cater to all abilities, a strong social atmosphere with weekly socials and tours to Devon (a tradition since 1955) and exotic locations such as Barbados in 2017. The 1st XI compete in the prestigious United Hospitals cup, aiming to go one better in 2022 than runners-up in the 2015, 2016 and 2020 campaigns. The 2nd XI compete in BUCS every Wednesday throughout the summer with a mixture of competitive and friendly cricket. The Ladies' XI train regularly at the Oval and play for the London Women's Team in the indoor and outdoor season. The club is active all year round, with weekly winter and spring training sessions at the Oval.

content: Welcome to Imperial College Dermatology Society. We are a society dedicated to increasing exposure to Dermatology in medical school and supporting students interested in a future career in Dermatology. Dermatology society is the perfect society for you if you want to learn more about what it means to be a Dermatologist. It is also a great society if you are unsure on what to specialise in in the future and want to explore. Through our events, you will gain opportunities to network and connect with others interested or in the field of Dermatology. We have a variety of events running every year including: academic tutorials on Dermatology for exams, career talks on the Dermatology specialty pathway, and a pan-London DermSoc conference (SkinSynergy) which include workshops such as suturing skills. We welcome all students to join us this year to learn more about Dermatology - we hope to see you at our events!

content: E.quinox is a student-led humanitarian organization at Imperial College London that aims to uplift rural Rwandan communities through research and technological innovation. The organization comprises students from diverse backgrounds and courses, who collaborate to create sustainable and affordable solutions for some of the world's poorest communities. E.quinox offers a wide range of projects, including hydroelectric kiosks and off-grid washing machines, providing members with hands-on experience and exposure to knowledge beyond the classroom. The organization also organizes annual expeditions to Rwanda to implement their solutions locally. Over the years, E.quinox has achieved notable accomplishments, such as providing electricity to over 400 households in Rwanda and Tanzania, and deploying their first off-grid washing machine in 2019. The organization welcomes individuals who want to learn new skills, discover a close-knit community, and use their knowledge to make a positive impact on the world.

content: Effective altruism is a global movement that aims to use evidence and reasoning to find the best ways to help others, and put them into practice. It's both a research field and a practical community that identifies the world's most pressing problems and the very best solutions to them. The community has worked on preventing malaria, ending animal factory farming, and protecting the long-term future from global catastrophic risks. The society focuses on supporting students interested in high-impact careers, offering speaker events, an 8-week introduction program, a technical reading group on AI Safety, and other events.

content: Welcome to the New and Improved Imperial College Endocrinology Society for 2023-24! Are you an aspiring endocrinologist or simply fascinated by the enchanting world of hormones? Look no further! Imperial College Endocrinology Society is your one-stop destination to meet fellow enthusiasts who share your fervor for all things endocrine. What's in Store for 2023-24: Educational Extravaganza: In the previous academic year, we set the stage with a sensational tutorial series for first and second-year BMB and MBBS students, receiving rave reviews and participation. But this year, brace yourself as we level up! We're expanding to create a tutorial series meticulously tailored to the clinical curriculum for our third-year MBBS students. Get ready to elevate your knowledge to new heights! Epic Conferences: February brought us our inaugural conference that featured six awe-inspiring talks from renowned endocrinologists. This year, we promise an even grander spectacle, with a broader range of topics that will take you on an exhilarating journey into the depths of endocrinology. Prepare to be amazed!

content: FemTech focuses on research and creation of products, tech, and services targeted towards female health. Despite females being nearly half of the world's population, an unbelievably small percentage of industry caters to female healthcare needs, making the rise of FemTech greatly important. Awareness of this industry has been rising rapidly with the growth of many start-ups focused on unmet needs in female healthcare, ranging from mental health, menstrual health, maternal health, fertility, period health, and more. The society will host talks by inspiring speakers changing female healthcare research, as well as business heads and influencers supporting this field. They will also have fun social events for networking and meeting like-minded individuals.

content: The Imperial College Finance Society (ICFS) is the foremost society for students looking for careers in Finance and we are the largest and most successful careers focused society on campus. Our events are aimed at providing our members with information about job opportunities in the City, a chance to talk to and network with industry contacts, and information useful for succeeding in your later career. We also hope to give members a chance to learn about what a job in the industry consists of, and if it's something that they'd be interested in pursuing. We specifically promote roles in investment banks, accountancy firms, private equity, hedge funds, and investment managers, and supplement your education with material helpful to applications and interviews. With a wide range of opportunities such as speeches from leading experts in their fields, term-long trading competitions, and even office visits, there are events for everyone with an interest in our field or even just curiosity to learn more. And as membership is free, there's no reason to not join!

content: As Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF, Doctors Without Borders), we support the international humanitarian aid organization. MSF's core values are independent, neutral, and impartial; aid workers go wherever they are needed the most. MSF works in remote locations around the globe as well as rapid relief efforts in countries such as Ukraine, Yemen, and Rohingya. In addition to emergency work, MSF builds long-term connections with governments to provide education and deliver prevention campaigns. At Imperial Friends of MSF, we are wholeheartedly committed to increasing awareness around MSF and raising money for the cause. We run many events throughout the year, including our flagship competition, the Makeathon, the Fun Run, and various speaker events.

content:
Hello and welcome! We are a group of students who are passionate about raising awareness on the Palestinian cause. 

Whether or not you are Palestinian, if you want to come show your support, appreciate the culture of Palestine, or understand more about the conflict, this is the place to come. We are a secular society, not affiliated to any political party. 

Join us for a year filled with insightful educational talks and fun socials as we showcase Palestinian history, culture, and heritage for everyone at Imperial to learn about!

Our previous events include talks with prominent academics and lawyers about the situation in Palestine through a Human Rights & International Law lens, a cultural-themed "Open Mic Night" fundraiser, documentary screenings, as well as collaborations with other societies at Imperial.

Joining a team is one of the best ways to have a tight circle of players from Imperial, whether you're looking to compete at the highest level in the national university leagues, or just to play casual weekly games. Our annual Varsity LAN against UCL is our keystone event of the year, hosted either on-site or in one of London's largest esports studios. You'll also have opportunities to meet other student gamers within Central London by joining our viewing parties of international tournaments, our socials, or by getting involved in our annual charity livestream! For those who are less interested in the competitive side, we run weekly in-person gaming sessions on Wednesday afternoons playing all sorts of console-based games. ICLGE has several consoles, Nintendo Switches and a huge selection of games to choose from during our meetups!

metadata.title: Gaming And Esports

Viewing parties of international tournaments, socials, and charity livestreams

The society organizes fieldtrips to places of great natural beauty across the UK, which are followed by a lovingly cooked dinner, fancy dress, and a chance to get to know fellow rock-enthusiasts. It also organizes evening/lunchtime talks throughout the year, where lecturers, PhD students, and field experts give fascinating lectures on up-and-coming topics in geology or their own current research. Additionally, the society hosts an annual symposium where six top geologists from across the country present on a chosen topic, with free lunch, an evening drinks reception, and a celebratory dinner at a local restaurant.

content: The International Tamil Society (ITS) at Imperial College is a vibrant and active society that celebrates Tamil culture and identity. It offers a wide range of events and activities, including award-winning sports teams, cultural talks, clubbing nights, dinner and dances, and entertaining socials. The society's flagship event is Mega Maalai, an annual evening of dance, music, and comedy that showcases the diverse Tamil culture and the global Tamil identity. ITS also raises funds for worthy causes and increases awareness of the issues faced by Tamil people worldwide, particularly due to the conflict in Sri Lanka. The society welcomes everyone, regardless of their Tamil background.

content: Join our mailing list and WhatsApp group for updates. Jiu Jitsu is a Japanese martial art that uses balance and movement rather than strength to defend against physical assault. Our training incorporates throws, joint locks, strikes, groundwork, and weapon attacks. Classes are on Tuesdays 8-10pm and Saturdays 2-4pm in the Union Gym, and are beginner-friendly. Get 3 free taster sessions. Hang around at the Union Bar after training to get to know the instructors and other club members. We aim to run 1-2 bigger socials this term. Our club is affiliated with Aiuchi Jiu Jitsu Association, which holds an annual national event for focused training. Gradings are held throughout the year, allowing you to progress through the belts.

content: Ju-jitsu is a Japanese martial art that focuses on using an opponent's power against them, employing a mixture of throws, joint locks and strikes. Our style, Shorinji Kan, is designed for practical defence in the modern world, from unwanted harassment to armed physical assault. Ju-Jitsu can be learned by anyone, regardless of gender or size. We welcome people of all experience and fitness levels throughout the year. Our club is affiliated with The Jiu Jitsu Foundation (TJJF). We meet with over 130 other affiliated clubs at competitions and gradings. Twice a year there are national competitions that our club takes part in. The first two weeks of the year are free for everyone, afterwards it only costs £20 per term! Our sessions are: Thursdays: 8 - 10pm, Union Gym (3rd floor) Sundays: 2 - 4pm, Union Gym (3rd floor)

content: ICKS is a cultural society that aims to create a family atmosphere for those of Korean descent or interested in Korean culture. Established in 1999 with a small group of members, the society has since grown significantly, with an average of 40 new members joining every year. Currently, the society has around 100 active members, with a female to male ratio of 40:60. ICKS organizes various events on campus, such as the ICKS Fresher Welcoming, ICKS Party, Korean Culture Night, ICKS Awards Ceremony, and ICKS annual dinner, to allow Korean students to come together, create friendships, and integrate with students of other ethnic backgrounds. The ICKS Football and Basketball teams participate in a private league and the OKSE Cup every Saturday. The society also includes the ICKC (Christianity group), a photography group, and an ICKS band. Additionally, ICKS holds monthly conferences with Oxbridge, where PhD students present their current projects. The society is also invited to attend various conferences organized by corporations such as Samsung Electronics, Hyundai Motors, Kia Motors, LG Philips, LG LCD, and LG Electronics.

content: The Krishna Consciousness Society at Imperial offers a platform to evolve the mind, give direction in life, and reveal deeper insights by connecting with like-minded people. The society is for open-minded, deep thinkers who take an interest in spirituality and viewing things from 'outside the box'. It presents Eastern philosophy and allows others to share their opinions on them. The society aims to reach beyond the boundaries of caste, creed, and color, by establishing the science of the soul, and to help students find spiritual solutions to material problems such as alcoholism, drug abuse, social and academic pressures by promoting simple living and high thinking. The society also aims to put students in touch with Eastern spiritual techniques, such as yoga and meditation, so they can apply ancient wisdom to modern life as a student.

content: IC Sinfonietta is a full symphony orchestra that plays a wide variety of enjoyable and challenging repertoire, known for its welcoming nature and great socials. The orchestra is conducted by Thomas Goff and rehearses every Monday at 18.30, followed by a trip to hbar or union. Sinfonietta has a highly deserved reputation as a very sociable orchestra, with socials organized throughout the year, including a weekend away in the first term. The orchestra puts on fantastic performances three times a year, featuring distinguished young soloists from Imperial. Sinfonietta is also one of the most traveled musical societies, touring yearly to locations such as Valencia, Croatia, Romania, and joint tours with ICSO to Prague, Zaragoza, and Burgos. The orchestra is always on the lookout for new players, with no audition required for strings or percussion, and occasional vacancies in woodwind, horns, and brass.

content: Imperial College Rifle and Pistol Club is one of the oldest Student Union clubs at Imperial College, with origins dating back to 1859. Members shoot weekly at the club's indoor range, which was built in 2013 and caters to various disciplines. The club also organizes trips to the National Shooting Centre in Bisley and clay shooting excursions. It competes in BUCS Clays, Fullbore, and Smallbore events, achieving successful results. The club welcomes shooters of all skill levels and provides the necessary equipment.

content: Imperial College Scuba Underwater Club is a BSAC (British Sub-Aqua Club) branch that offers internationally recognized diver qualifications. They have qualified volunteer instructors and a wide range of diving equipment available for hire, making their courses more affordable than other training providers. The club caters to divers of all skill levels, from beginners to technical divers, and welcomes those with non-BSAC qualifications to cross over and continue learning with them. In addition to diving training, the club also offers extracurricular courses such as boat driving, wreck appreciation, and Seasearch for UK marine life surveying. They organize trips to dive hotspots in the UK and abroad, including a week-long training trip to Cornwall during Easter and annual summer tours to destinations like Costa Brava, Croatia, Lanzarote, and Malta. The club meets at the bar in Beit Quad on Tuesdays around 7 pm, and newcomers are welcome to join.

content: Squash is a fast-paced, energetic racket sport enjoyed by players for over 130 years and now played by more than 15 million people in over 150 countries. ICSM (Imperial College School of Medicine) has a long and proud tradition of squash, with the club catering to a wide range of skill levels, from complete beginners to seasoned pros. Members practice multiple times a week at various locations, with special training sessions and drills tailored to individual abilities. For competitive play, the club enters teams in the LUSL (London Universities Sports League) leagues on Monday evenings. The club also has an active social scene, with events like club curries and themed pub crawls. The club aims to be accessible to all, providing brand new shoes and rackets for members to use.

content: The IC Sri Lankan Society is a close-knit family that has been around for over 30 years, making it one of the oldest and most successful societies at Imperial College Union. The society's goal is to bring the vibrancy, diversity, and warmth of Sri Lankan culture to Imperial and the UK. Their flagship event, Sapphire, is the largest Sri Lankan event in the UK, attracting over 1000 guests from across the country to enjoy authentic Sri Lankan food, entertainment, and the company of friends. The society has also raised £75,000 for charities uplifting Sri Lanka, including aiding children in the Northern Province to gain access to clean drinking water and helping restore eyesight to thousands through cataract operations. By contributing to Sapphire 2022's success, you not only help raise an invaluable contribution to philanthropic ventures back home but also develop a skill set that is in short supply and high demand. The society's celebration of Lankan culture extends throughout the year, with events such as the Warwick University Cricket Tournament, Christmas and Avurudhu meals, baila-jam sessions, and weekly meetings.

content: TEDxImperialCollege is an independently organized TEDx event held at Imperial College.

IC Lawn Tennis Club is one of the largest societies at Imperial with over 200 members. We cater for tennis players of all levels from beginners to players who represent Imperial in inter-university leagues/tournaments. Our thriving weekly tennis sessions offer all standards of players courts, rackets, balls and coaching advice. Our six teams are among the best in the region, with both the Men and Women 1st teams in the Premier South League. We have 4 Men's, 2 Women's teams, and an additional Mixed Team! The club has great success in recent years, winning Sport Imperial's Club of the Year in 2012, 2014 and 2018. Previous tours to Spain, Italy and France have provided opportunities to play on an international stage. Our ever expanding social side includes exclusive nights at top clubs, comedy clubs and celebratory dinners. The club runs an annual ballot for Wimbledon tickets and also has access to tickets to see the top eight players in the world battle it out at the O2 at the ATP tour finals. Our courts include Virgin Active Fulham, Bishop's Park, and weekly training indoors at the prestigious Queen's Club. We also have a university-wide league to suit all standards who want to play competitive tennis, are competing in the new LTA-organised University Team Challenge for recreational players, as well as organise regular friendly matches against other London universities.

content: The Yacht Club offers sailing opportunities for both beginners and seasoned racers, with activities on the beautiful South Coast of the UK, including weekend trips, long weekends, and week-long cruises. The club caters to all levels, with qualified skippers and mates on board, and organizes discounted RYA courses to make this sport accessible to Imperial College staff and students. The club also participates in the British universities yachting nationals, providing a chance to race and socialize with students from across the UK.

content: IC Yoga Club offers affordable weekly yoga and meditation classes for students, staff, and alumni at various Imperial College campuses. The classes cater to all levels, from beginners to advanced practitioners, with professionally trained instructors guiding participants through different styles of yoga. The club aims to help attendees improve their fitness, reduce stress, and increase flexibility.
